page.title: 12STOTFOLD BYPASS--OPINIONS
page.content: Argument is raging in Stotfold over the proposed by-pass,with seprate groups campaigning in the town. More than{2,000}forms were sent to Stotfold residents this week asking which route they would prefer if the bypass gets the go-ahead.The argument is split between the{NORTHERN}and {SOUTHERN}by pass routes. Mr{Arther Castle}said that both arguments are based on{"Danger to {children and conservation." The county council seem to favour the Southern option which is shorter and cheaper.This route would also help{Letchworth}traffic to the{A1}. The southern route leaves the A507 and runs round the back of Etonbury school and joins the Hitchin road. by Matthew Ranson
